meta.title: PHP Mastery Quiz Pro
meta.description: Test your PHP knowledge with this interactive quiz

questions.question: What does PHP stand for?
questions.explanation: PHP originally stood for Personal Home Page, but it now stands for PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor (a recursive acronym).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid PHP variable name?
questions.explanation: Variable names in PHP can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores. Hyphens are not allowed.

questions.question: What is the result of echo "1" + "2" in PHP?
questions.explanation: PHP performs type juggling. When using the + operator with strings that contain numbers, PHP converts them to numbers before adding.

questions.question: Which function is used to check if a variable is an array?
questions.explanation: The is_array() function is the correct PHP function to check if a variable is an array.

questions.question: What does the === operator compare in PHP?
questions.explanation: The === operator is the identical operator in PHP, which checks both value and type.

questions.question: Which of these is used to start a session in PHP?
questions.explanation: session_start() is the correct function to start a new session or resume an existing one.

questions.question: What is the correct way to include a file in PHP?
questions.explanation: The include statement is used to include and evaluate the specified file.

questions.question: What does the NULL value represent in PHP?
options: A variable with no value assigned
A variable set to an empty string
A variable that has not been declared
questions.answer: A variable with no value assigned
questions.explanation: NULL in PHP represents a variable with no value or a variable that has been unset.
